intro: Cephalomanes ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's sea hare, is a species of sea hare found in the Indo-Pacific region. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its elongated, soft body covered in a layer of mucus. The species exhibits a distinctive coloration, often featuring a mix of yellow, brown, and white markings. It is primarily a herbivorous species, feeding on algae and other marine plants. Cephalomanes ledermannii plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the grazing pressure on algae populations.
